abstract: NFL penalizes Atlanta Falcons and Cleveland Browns for off-the-field infractions in previous season; suspends Browns general manager Ray Farmer for four games in 2015 for illegal in-game texting, fining team an additional $250,000; Falcons will pay $350,000 fine and forfeit fifth-round draft pick in 2016 for using recorded crowd noises in 2013 and 2014.
lead_paragraph: The league suspended Cleveland General Manager Ray Farmer for four games for sending text messages to coaches during games. Atlanta will forfeit a draft pick for piping in crowd noise.

headline.main: N.F.L. Punishes Falcons and Browns for Rules Violations
headline.print_headline: Browns and Falcons Cited for Off-the-Field Infractions
